lexa.core.data.config

Class ConfigDataSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • lexa.core.data.BaseDataSet
      • lexa.core.data.ArrayDataSet
        • lexa.core.data.config.ConfigDataSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<DataSet>, java.lang.Iterable<DataItem>, ConfigObject, DataFactoryItem, DataSet

    public class ConfigDataSet
extends ArrayDataSet
implements ConfigObject
    A DataSet for storing configuration data.
    This is used for loading and parsing configuration items. Once read, the object should be closed to ensure that all items have been read.
    An extension of a ArrayDataSet. This will behave in all respects like a data set with the added trace of path within the whole set and checking that all the data has been read when closing.
    Since:
    2016-09
    Author:
    William

      • ConfigDataSet

        public ConfigDataSet(DataSet data)
        Constructor that wraps the configuration data.
        No modification can be made to this data set, though it can be cloned. The cloned data set can be modified.
        Parameters:
        data - a DataSet containing the configuration.

      • get

        public ConfigDataItem get(java.lang.String key,
                          java.lang.Object defaultValue)
                   throws DataException
        Get a ConfigDataItem from the list for the supplied key. Either get the configured setting or the default value if missing.
        Parameters:
        key - The key for the ArrayDataItem.
        defaultValue - the default value
        Returns:
        The corresponding ConfigDataItem if it exists, otherwise a new item containing with the given default.
        Throws:
        DataException - when the stored value is not the same as the default value
